comment: If you don't have common sense, do not take her. I had her for micro lab, and when someone asked a question, she would often make a smart remark as if we were already supposed to know the ins and outs of the content. Also, she hasn't graded anything after the midterm (February). It's May...

Professor was 30 minutes late probably every class meeting for the first part of the semester and only came on time after we (students) complained to the department head. She also NEVER kept the grade book updated. As of right now (one week exactly after our final exam), there is only one assignment in the gradebook. Would NOT recommend.

She is not horrible but if you could take someone else do it. I had her 8am lab and she was late most of the time. One time she was late for 40 minutes... also she does not respond to emails so don't even bother trying to reach out. She rushes labs but shes the one who's late and honeslty when you try asking her something she makes you feel dumb.

Had her for lab in the morning and I would not recommend. She does not respect your time and was constantly late. She was late 40 minutes once and as a commuter, that says a lot. She rushes you through labs and did not feel like a learning experience.

The only downside to Dr.R was her email response, despite that she's actually understanding and would accommodate her test to online if we asked. If you did good in her class there was no reason to blow up her email about your grade in the class, so that should say a lot about those bad reviews. She made the class fairly easy for a microbio lab.

She was the worst professor I've ever had at KSU. She refused to respond to emails (I had to get the department head involved, but she still didn't respond. She took a month to get test grades in. She was very monotone and required attendance for lectures. Avoid her lectures and lab classes if you want to keep your sanity.

Takes forever to grade, didn't answer a single student email the entire semester and told us at the end of the last lecture that the attendance wasn't a participation grade, but was actually based on accuracy of the in class, Kahoot assignments

Part 2/2. First exam took her over a month to grade, and when asked about it she would just give you the same excuse that they'll be released the next day. When she did release them, she did only a portion of students. When i went to ask her about it, she graded my exam in front of me and took her less than 10 minutes. Frustrated all semester long.

I've never had a professor with so much unprofessionalism. Never answers email, so don't even waste your time. She gave us no information on the final until 3 days before. Attendance was mandatory but the lectures weren't engaging so you had to sit through class. Part 1/2

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS UNLESS YOU'RE GOOD AT TEACHING YOURSELF! she NEVER responds to emails, and she took over a month to grade the first test. her lectures don't make sense at ALL, but attendance is graded so you have to sit through class lol. please please please do yourself a favor and take literally anyone else, your GPA will thank you for it

Make sure you can teach yourself if you take her class. She never answers emails, takes over a month to grade tests, and just reads over already posted slides during lecture. However she counts attendance that goes toward your grade, so you must sit through the monotonous lectures every week

exams are just like review/kahoots in class. attendance is weird, she doesn't explain it much. almost every lecture has a kahoot which counts as your attendance. WILL NOT ANSWER EMAILS regardless of how many times you've emailed. very frustrating

Worst professor I've ever had. Took over two months to respond to an email only after I emailed her supervisor about it. Very rude to her students. Gets frustrated easily if you do not know what to do yet she never explains things efficiently. I would recommend staying as far away from this professor as possible.

This class requires hard work and studying like any other science class you have to take but the professor is extremely nice. She is willing to work with you if you need help . She does take time to grade but if you study and show up to class then you will not have to worry about your grades
Lots of extra credit opportunities in exams. Exams are similar to review and quizzes. There are class activities that help understand the lecture

Most people that complain about her did not show up to class and did not study. She is a great professor and was always willing to open up any missed assignments. Her tests also include extra credit in the form of free response question which she goes over during her reviews. Her tests come from review and quiz questions.

Very caring professor. her exams come from her class review and quizzes. She does class activities as well for participation and to help you understand the lectures better. Show up to class and you will do fine
If you study and show

Dr. R cares a lot about her students. She wants everyone to succeed. Her tests are very similar to her review and quizzes. She also offers a lot of bonus points in the tests. If you show up and study, you will do well in her class

Do not listen to the bad reviews. She is an amazing professor. She cares about her students and is extremely lenient. If you miss any assignments she lets you do them. Her tests are not extremely difficult either. They come straight from the review/quiz questions. She does take some time to grade but if you study you will do well

Random class activities and quizzes, so attendance is required unless you're lucky. The entire course grades only off 4 Tests plus a final (one of which gets dropped, online homework quizzes, and attendance points. She has yet to grade an Exam taken over a month ago and have no clue where I am at in the class. Have to put in work to pass.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Was late to almost every test including the final, the lecture has no clear direction. Yes there's a textbook but good luck following it. The pptx helped but only so much, I learned more in lab than I did in her lectures. She's not a bad person, just not the best teacher and the tests were difficult on things that were not covered or breezed over.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Didn't grade a single thing until after the grades were due. They were due on December 15, it's the 21st, no grades. You get graded for 8 quizzes (1 in-person MC, 6 online MC, 1 paper-like quiz) and your final lab report. The bio lab has loud ventilation, and all she does is stand in the front and mumble. Overall unprofessional and uncaring.

Please avoid her if you can! She is great as a person but not as a professor. Reads straight from PPT, doesn't give a study guide to study from. Avoid her at all costs. Me and my classmates are stressed out!
Her lectures are extremely boring and difficult to understand. If you're good at teaching yourself I'd suggest it, but for those who need someone to teach them, she is not the person for it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: This was the worst class I've ever taken. A lot of classes cancelled 30 minutes before class time (8 a.m) and I would find out through d2l, no email. There were no grades put in before the final withdrawal date. We were given the criteria for our semester long lab report the week before finals. When I emailed about grades, she wouldn't answer.

She's ok for lab, doesn't really help/direct the class so if you've never worked in a lab setting, it can be an adjustment. Graded on lab quizzes & a final lab report. Towards the beginning of the semester, she graded quizzes in a decent amt of time but by mid-semester, nothing has been graded for weeks. She doesn't respond to emails often.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: The most unorganized professor I've ever had. Cancels class more times than not but doesn't email you. She blew passed all her exam dates without mentioning them, then gave us all of the work for the class the Friday before Thanksgiving, including two tests and a paper we were supposed to have all semester to do. I have zero respect for her. AVOID.

Take her for lab!!! She is an easy grader. All her lab quizzes are online on D2L and they are pretty easy. The final is an unknown lab report but due to COVID it was just a lab practicum over the first 4 labs. Very easy as long as you have read the labs and have all the data

Dr. R reads over her vague PowerPoint slides and asks iClicker questions during lecture (for participation). Her iClicker and online quiz questions are not that bad but her test questions are horrible. Roughly 30-40% of the test is filled with vague questions that you wont know how to answer properly. Avoid taking her if you can.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: The pre-lab lectures she gives are always short and straightforward, and she is super helpful if you have any questions during the labs. She's also funny! As long as you understand the labs and do well on the quizzes (given on D2L), this will be an easy class!

Dr. R just reads off the power points and you have to go to class to get your iClicker attendance grade. The tests are hard, but are based off the homework and iClicker questions. Not the worst class, but definitely boring.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: she's nice but harsh harsh grader. Her tests are very tricky bc they include all of the above, none of the above type of stuff along with random free response. Majority of class got 30s 40s on tests!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. R is great for lab, read before hand youll get done early and do well on the quizzes. However, I would avoid her for lecture. She doesnt seem very knowledgeable about the subject and thus reads off the PowerPoint. Most of your understanding will come from the book. The exams are nothing like what she tells you, theyre very random info
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER!!!! Attendance is pretty much mandatory but going to class is a complete waste of time. She reads directly from the incredibly vague powerpoints she creates and does not offer any other explanation. Her tests are impossibly hard and purposefully tricky. She is UNWILLING TO HELP YOU! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!!!!!!!!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I think some students are being harsh on her. She is actually nice and sweet person once you get to know her. However, she doesn't really explain stuff in class, instead just reads off the powerpoint! Also her tests are hard because same material doesn't show up. Usually 12-12 LONG Lecture powerpoints for one test so lots of material!!!

TAKE HER FOR LAB BUT NOT LECTURE! she's very helpful and laid back in lab and always willing to work with you. Lab consists of pre-lab quizes which can be hard if you dont read in DETAIL (mostly free response) and then post lab quizes after class. The final report gets messy so make sure you really know what you are doing!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS
